content:
PGDB - Proteogenomics Database Generation

Bioinformatics pipeline for generating comprehensive proteogenomics databases that integrate multiple protein sources into unified databases for mass spectrometry-based proteomics analysis. Combines reference proteomes with variant-derived proteins, non-coding translations, and decoys.

What is PGDB?

ProteoGenomics Database (PGDB) enables discovery of novel proteins and peptides by creating expanded protein databases that include non-canonical proteins, genetic variants, and alternative translations often missed in standard proteomic searches.

Key Features

  • Multi-Source Integration: ENSEMBL + variants + non-canonical
  • Variant Databases: COSMIC, cBioPortal, GENOMAD support
  • Non-Canonical Proteins: Pseudogenes, sORFs, lncRNAs
  • Decoy Generation: Automatic decoy database creation
  • Format Flexibility: Multiple output formats
  • Automated Download: Fetches databases automatically

Database Components

  1. Reference Proteome: Download from ENSEMBL
  2. Genetic Variants: COSMIC cancer mutations, cBioPortal alterations, GENOMAD variants
  3. Non-Canonical Proteins: Pseudogene translations, Small ORFs (sORFs), Long non-coding RNA (lncRNA) translations
  4. Decoy Sequences: Reversed or shuffled for FDR calculation

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Proteome Download: Fetch ENSEMBL reference proteome
  2. Variant Translation: Convert genomic variants to protein sequences
  3. Non-Coding Translation: Add pseudogenes, sORFs, lncRNAs
  4. Database Merging: Combine all protein sources
  5. Decoy Generation: Create target-decoy database
  6. Formatting: Export in appropriate formats

Scientific Applications

  • Cancer Proteogenomics: Identify mutation-derived neoantigens
  • Variant Proteomics: Detect variant peptides
  • Novel Protein Discovery: Find non-canonical translations
  • Personalized Medicine: Patient-specific databases
  • Immunopeptidomics: Neoantigen prediction

Database Features

  • Comprehensive Coverage: Beyond canonical proteins
  • Variant Integration: Include known mutations
  • Quality Controlled: Validated sequences
  • Reproducible: Automated and standardized
  • Customizable: Organism and variant source selection

Advantages

  • One-Stop Solution: All database sources integrated
  • Automated Process: Minimal manual intervention
  • Up-to-Date: Uses latest database versions
  • Flexible: Customizable for specific needs
  • Well-Documented: Clear usage guidelines

Input Requirements

  • Organism Information: Species and ENSEMBL ID
  • Sample Sheet: Configuration details
  • Optional: Custom variant files
  • Optional: Specific ENSEMBL version

Main Outputs

  • Protein FASTA: Combined protein database
  • Target-Decoy FASTA: With decoy sequences
  • Annotation Files: Protein source information
  • Variant Mapping: Variant-to-protein links
  • Statistics: Database composition metrics
  • Format-Specific: Multiple database formats

Perfect for: Proteogenomics • Variant Proteomics • Cancer Research • Novel Proteins • Immunopeptidomics
